quizInfo.Subject: Professional Issues in Information Systems and Technology
quizInfo.Title: Full Course Review

quizData.question: Integrated Elements that gather, process, save, and disseminate information to support an organization's decision-making and management.

What application is this?

What application is this?

eLMS.

Social media to communicate and share information.

It is the series of steps taken to accomplish the desired goal.

What year did Peter Drucker said that information and information systems would become increasingly important?
These are the professionals who make and modify knowledge as a fundamental part of their jobs.

What era is this?
Information systems were centralized and concerned solely with governance and the needs of management.

What era is this?
Most systems and reports are controlled by accounting departments.

What era is this?
Included 3rd-gen mainframe computers such as the IBM 360 and minicomputers.

What era is this?
Languages include Assembler, Fortran, COBOL, etc.

What era is this?
More departments were beginning to benefit from the technology.

What era is this?
Steering committees and user-led initiatives determine the scope of additional information system projects.

What era is this?
Included the first PCs.

What era is this?
Concentrated information systems started to spread and information became deconcentrated.

What era is this?
Costs decreased.

What era is this?
Chief Information Officer (CIO) as a position arose in many companies.

What era is this?
Technology included internetworking and the emergence of the internet.

What era is this?
Information systems are still tied to governance and management, although the systems are widely distributed to every employee who needs them across multiple platforms.

What era is this?
Combined all aspects of the business enterprise, offering rich information access surrounding the complete management structure.

What era is this?
Now includes social media, search engines, laptops, etc.

What era is this?
Uses networking technology that deliver applications and data storage independent of the configuration or location of the hardware.

What era is this?
Led to new levels of flexibility, such as cloud computing.

What era is this?
Rising global competitiveness has forced companies to find better and more cost-effective ways.

What era is this?
Solution for companies continues to be to use information systems to accomplish tasks better, faster, and cheaper.

Mainframe and Minicomputer

What era is this?

What category of information systems is this?
Handles day-to-day business data at the operational level of the organization.

What category of information systems is this?
Systematically processes customer transactions to generate a considerable amount of data.

What category of information systems is this?
Commonly applied in a grocery store checkout cash registers that connect to anetwork.

What category of information systems is this?
Produces detailed and specified information to help manage a company.

What category of information systems is this?
Used when TPS data are sorted and organized to support a broad range of managerial decision.

What category of information systems is this?
Used primarily for inventory management and planning systems.

What category of information systems is this?
Retrieves TPS info, collects it, and generates reports to have relevant insights on a situation.

What category of information systems is this?
Summaries and comparisons allow managers to optimize the decision-making process to achieve better resorts.

What category of information systems is this?
Supports a wide range of predefined day-to-day work activities of individuals and businesses.

What category of information systems is this?
Involves apps such as Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.

What category of information systems is this?
Help organizations to effectively capture, store, and retrieve organizational knowledge to enhance learning and optimize collaboration efforts to complete tasks.

What category of information systems is this?
Involves documents such as employee training materials, company policies, etc.

What category of information systems is this?
Analyzes data and support decision-making.

What category of information systems is this?
Utilized by managerial-level employees to resolve problems such as sales forecasting and resource optimization.

What category of information systems is this?
Designed to be interactive decision aid that applied models to manipulate data.

What category of information systems is this?
Represent a new application model in information systems.

What category of information systems is this?
Represent a niche application model for companies and business systems needing mobile information broadcasting and simple applications.

What category of information systems is this?
Apps like Instagram and Office Mobile are best for businesses whose customers are mainly targeted online for faster and more convenient transactions.

What category of information systems is this?
Science of allowing information technologies to simulate human intelligence, such as reasoning and learning.

What category of information systems is this?
Significantly impact various areas, such as banking and financial management, etc.

This is more than just qualifications, knowledge, and skill; but is also about integrity, ethics, and trust.

This is practicing and maintaining a high level of valued professionalism will create stronger relationship with clients, employers, the team, and the public who will use or benefit from the products and services.
Its essence is not just for the job but also for how the job is done.
It is where someone possesses a set of values, behaviors, and broader responsibilities in how the professional's knowledge and skills are applied.
It's about having an informed, ethical, and strategic approach to work for the greater good and the wider benefit.
The idea of professionalism and modern professions originated from trade guilds and the learned societies for the church, law, and medicine. (TR or FL)
The concepts of professionalism, profession, and professionalization have met considerable and critical attention in sociology through various interpretations and analyses. (TR or FL)
What interpretation depicts that professionalism was determined to be an occupational value for the stability and ordinance of social systems?
What interpretation depicts that professional Relations (PR) were cooperative and mutually supportive in this interpretation?

What interpretation depicts that relations of trust represented the employee-client, and employee-management interactions as competence were presumed as a guarantee through education, training, and licensing?
What interpretation depicts that during the 1970s-1980s, professionalism was dismissed as a successful principle and professionalization as a process of authority over occupation or a market?
What interpretation depicts that professionalization promotes a professional's occupational self-interest in salary and power?
What interpretation depicts that it was a process initiated and controlled by the employees through professional institutions and associations to promote and protect their self-interests?

What interpretation depicts that it involved the analysis of professionalism as a discourse of occupational change and control, especially in organizations wherein it was increasingly applied and utilized by managers?
What interpretation depicts that there is an important difference between the discourse of professionalism as built "from within"?
What interpretation depicts that it can also be from the occupational group itself and as-built "from above" or by managers in work organizations?
What interpretation depicts that when discourse is built from within, the benefits to the group can be significant?

What interpretation depicts that the occupational group uses the discourse to build its occupational identity, promote its image with clients and customers, and secure and promote the occupational control of work by employees?
What interpretation depicts that studies in the early 21st century demonstrated that professionalism presents advantages for both clients and employees?

What interpretation depicts that it highlighted the importance of maintaining professionalism and trust, competence, and discretion as the main organizing principles for service work in modern societies?
What characteristic of professionalism is about knowing what is appropriate in different situations as it avoids awkwardness or upset, boosts credibility and helps to feel job security?
What characteristic of professionalism relates to outward appearances, such as dressing, hygiene, and body language?
What characteristic of professionalism covers the way of speaking and writing in selecting a topic to discuss and behavior with others?
What characteristic of professionalsim is about a professional who gets the job done and done well?
What characteristic of professionalism is the ability must meet the role's requirements to produce results that exceed expectations?
What characteristic of professionalism manages the expectations of others and identifies when it is necessary to ask for support?
What characteristic of professionalism reassures and motivates other people by boosting the ability to influence and lead?
What characteristic of professionalism encourages everyone to take on new challenges as the risk of damaging their professional reputation if things go wrong is non-existent?
What characteristic of professionalsim involves being reliable, setting high standards, and displaying care in every aspect of the job?
What characteristic of professionalism is about being diligent and organized and holding oneself accountable for thoughts, words, and actions, no matter the results?
What characteristic of professionalism should not be confused with working longer hours than everyone else or obsessing about details?
What characteristic of professionalism states that true professionals plan and prioritize their work to keep it under control while not letting perfectionism hold them back?
What characteristic of professionalism is staying professional under pressure?
What characteristic of professionalism requires strategies for managing emotions and clear awareness of other people's feelings and thoughts?
What characteristic of professionalism means keeping emotions in check, but at the same time expressing feelings for meaningful and fruitful conversations is necessary?
What characteristic of professionalism is staying true to one's word?
What characteristic of professionalism stops one from compromising their values, even if that means taking a bigger risk?
What characteristic of professionalism is the commitment to being honest to oneself and others?
What characteristic of professionalism states that when beliefs and behaviors are aligned, genuineness reflects?
What characteristic of professionalism involves detailed and up-to-date knowledge which is highly specialized?
What characteristic of professionalism states that one can master a role and a specialization by learning new knowledge at every stage of their careers?
What characteristic of professionalism is vital to put into action?
What characteristic of professionalism is being confident to show that knowledge is not for self-promotion but for helping others succeed?
What characteristic of professionalism is about being a role model for politeness and displaying good manners to everyone, not just to impress specific people?
What characteristic of professionalism take others' needs into account and help uphold their rights?
What principle of professionals at work states that employees must know the expectations in how they communicate?
What principle of professionals at work states that employees must have the resources they need to developer their communication skills?
What principle of professionals at work states that quality back-and-forth eliminate unnecessary problems and promote better productivity in the workplac?
What principle of professionals at work effectively creates a strong team connection, increasing overall performance?
What principle of professionals at work states that if employees consult and consider the views of others, their interest in cooperation increases leading to finding the best possible solutions?
What principle of professionals at work builds a strong employee relationship as the more they work closely, the more they get to know and develop a liking for each other?
What principle of professionals at work states that the more they work together, the more they learn and adapt to living with each others' likes, dislikes, strengths, and weaknesses?
What principle of professionals at work reduces toxic work culture, driven by drama, low morale at work, lack of communication, and the fear of a boss?
What principle of professionals at work is enhanced by participating in team-building activities to practice relying on others' strengths and consulting doubts and confusions as soon as they arise?
What principle of professionals at work allows a professional to analyze information, arrive at conclusions, and make sound decisions?
What principle of professionals at work is an essential skill everyone must improve?
What principle of professionals at work is valuable in any role in an organization?

What principle of professionals at work is developed through communication and creative problem-solving as it allows the free-flowing connections of ideas to evaluate arguments, find errors, and solve complex issues?

What principle of professionals at work states that one must prioritize taking on high-risk problems that need immediate action to practice this skill while ensuring the correctness and quality of the output?
What principle of professionals at work aligns the behavior of employees to the company's visions?
What principle of professionals at work promotes openness, partnership, and trust?
What principle of professionals at work states that when employees know supervisors' expectations, they do better in their jobs?
What principle of professionals at work states that one must always mind the stakes involved in any aspect of the job to ensure actions are bounded by what is morally correct and acceptable?
What principle of professionals at work states that recognizing its importance helps employees feel secure as threats such as harassment and bullying are absent, and respect is thriving?
What principle of professionals at work is expressed through natural human values and unique talents and perspectives that employees contribute?
What principle of professionals at work states that humanity is dynamic as it incorporates the innate need for purpose, growth, and work-life balance simultaneously?
What principle of professionals at work states that practicing being kind, accepting, and emotionally available is a massive step towards achieving humanness in the workplace?
What principle of professionals at work states that it doesn't require additional skills but the natural values to do good around people?
What principle of professionals at work states that professionals today want to be a part of something larger than themselves, something that in some way positively impacts the human experience?
It is the analysis of human actions from the perspective of "good" and "evil" or of "morally correct" and "morally wrong".
It deals with responsibilities, rights, use of language, significance of ethical life, and how people make moral decisions.
It is one of the methods to navigate new ethical issues in an organization.
It outlines a set of acceptable behaviors in a professional or social group generally agreed to by its members.
It specifies various actions that are considered appropriate and inappropriate.
What General Ethical Responsibility deals with protecting fundamental human rights and one's right to autonomy?
quizData.answer: Contribute to society and human well-being
choices: Contribute to society and human well-being
Be fair and act not to discriminate

quizData.question: Communication technology enables the collection and exchange of personal info, resulting in a decreased potential for privacy violations. (TR or FL)

quizData.question: What Professional Issue at Work states that work is good for mental health, but a poor workplace can lead to physical and mental health problems?

This is the condition where moral conflict arises in the workplace where moral standards are challenged?
These are complicated challenges that cannot easily be solved, making the ability to find the ideal solution critical to everyone.
This is the problem between 2 feasible options wherein neither is acceptance from an ethical perspectives.
What Ethical Issue states that having issues with a superior is one thing and reporting it is another?
What Ethical Issue states that issues can come in any form, some can be noticeable while some may occur subtly?
What Ethical Issue states that the best way to address issues with a superior is by dealing with the superior and how it affects the team's productivity?
What Ethical Issue states that superiors who easily dismiss work issues are at risk of disrespecting and putting their employees at risk?
What Ethical Issue states that with the mindset of hiring someone "culturally fit", a toxic culture can be worsened by repopulating the company with like-minded personalities with toxic mentalities?
What Ethical Issue states that it's encouraged to lead with respect to the code of ethics as well as taking into consideration of everyone's mental and physical wellness?
What Ethical Issue states that discrimination do not just cross an ethical line but also a legal one?
Companies are vigilant in avoiding costly legal and public backlash related to discrimination and harassment. (TR or FL)
Disengaging conversations that lead to discrimination and harassing territory is a good start. (TR or FL)
What Ethical Issue states that one should never show enthusiasm with "jokes" with malicious intent, and as always, talking to HR is the best solution?
What Ethical Issue states that companies often set unrealistic and unattainable goals to motivate employees?
What Ethical Issue states that unrealistic objectives can put heightened pressure on employees, causing corner cutting or breach of ethical or legal guidelines to obtain them?
What Ethical Issue states that making sure that a goal is attainable should be practiced as well as setting up a good timetable and plan for its execution?
What way of solving an ethical dilemma states that situations must be carefully analyzed as in some cases?
What way of solving an ethical dilemma states that ethical dilemmas can be logically refuted?
What way of solving an ethical dilemma states that one must determine an alternative that offers the greater good or the lesser evil than the other?
What way of solving an ethical dilemma states that problems can be viewed through a different lens, resulting in alternative solutions?
Ethical Issues can be addressed based on simply adhering to the provided code of ethics. (TR or FL)
Ethical Dilemma exists when 2 or more ethical principles or standards conflict with each other. (TR or FL).
This is a crime committed in cyberspace using information technologies.
What cybercrime category are offenses committed with or without technology but increased their reach using such technologies?
What cybercrime category is also described as "technology-as-instrument" offenses?
What cybercrime category is strictly committed using information and communication technologies?
